item.title: Learning about Variables
item.dc:creator: @new_IoSession new IoSession();
item.description:
@new_IoSession wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:17, topic:275858”][quote author=new IoSession(); link=topic=364386.msg2769052#msg2769052 date=1241007684]
Could also be:

private void checkHappiness() {
	System.out.println(isHappy ? "You are happy" : "You are not happy");
}

[/quote]

I never knew that, you just taught me something new. I may use that.[/quote]

It’s just a shortcut for the if statement. You cannot use it like this:

private void example() {	
	myExample ? execute() : destroy();
}

You can only use it while setting a variable to another value or use it when calling a method.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning about Variables
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“new IoSession();, post:16, topic:275858”]Could also be:

private void checkHappiness() { System.out.println(isHappy ? "You are happy" : "You are not happy"); } [/quote]

I never knew that, you just taught me something new. I may use that.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning about Variables
item.dc:creator: @new_IoSession new IoSession();
item.description:
@new_IoSession wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:1, topic:275858”]If you have a method that depended on [tt]isHappy[/tt] being true or false, it would look something like this:

public void happyPerson() { if (isHappy) { System.out.println("You are happy."); } else { System.out.println("You are not happy."); } }[/quote]

Could also be:

private void checkHappiness() {
	System.out.println(isHappy ? "You are happy" : "You are not happy");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Learning about Variables
item.dc:creator: @Maxie35 Maxie35
item.description:
@Maxie35 wrote:

vic 08:

This was pointless, you wasted about a hour of your time doing this. You even know that almost everyone on these forums will be like “Y DUS THIS METR WEN I CAN JUS COPY SUM1 ELSES CODE!”.

Thats wrong, i’ve been coding RSPS for maybe 1 year now? and i’m not that experienced coder… but I do whatever i can do to learn more about it, and this really helped. I already knew a few parts of this, but I also learned from it.

I’m pretty sure other people think about this the same way as I do, the only people who say “Y DUS THIS METR WEN I CAN JUS COPY SUM1 ELSES CODE!” are dumb people who really dont give a … about Java coding, but just wanna make a private server without Learning anything about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning about Variables
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“jGod, post:9, topic:275858”][quote author=primadude link=topic=364386.msg2768237#msg2768237 date=1240952556]

I thought you weren’t allowed to post Java tutorials.

You should fix a few things such as how you say Strings are used for characters; I believe the char datatype exists for that. Also you should use the correct terminology for parameters of a method.

He included codes within most private servers, which is an exception:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("command")) { //Command actions in here }

And also you don’t have to correct everything that people get wrong. I see you a lot of the time correcting people all over the place.
[/quote]

I haven’t posted on here in over a month.

Also why wouldn’t you want me to correct someone if they’re wrong? Other people can get the right knowledge then.[/quote]

If you put it that way it doesn’t seem that bad :/.

Read full topic
